meanings.definition: Grasped or seized with the hands.
meanings.sent1: She claughted the ball and threw it to her friend.
meanings.sent2: He claughted the rope to pull himself up the tree.
meanings.sent3: The little girl claughted her teddy bear tightly before going to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The idea claughted her mind, refusing to let go.
meanings.sent5: His fingers claughted the edge of the table as he tried to stand up.

meanings.sent1: The fisherman claughted a big fish in the river.
meanings.sent2: The police finally claughted the thief after a long chase.
meanings.sent3: The butterfly was claughted in the net, fluttering its wings in protest.
meanings.sent4: Her attention was claughted by the colorful painting on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The photograph claughted the moment of pure joy perfectly.

meanings.sent1: Her claughted fists showed her determination to succeed.
meanings.sent2: The dog's teeth were claughted around the bone, not letting go.
meanings.sent3: The claughted jar refused to open no matter how hard she tried.
meanings.sent4: His jaw was claughted in frustration, unable to speak.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wrinkled hand was claughted around the worn photograph.
